originalTitle: Bobi Wine tells the BBC from hiding he will not contest Uganda election results in court
title: Bobi Wine tells the BBC from hiding he will not contest Uganda election results in court
content: The losing presidential candidate calls for "peaceful change", saying Uganda's judiciary is not independent.

title: Nigeria remembers master wood carver
content: Kasali Akangbe Ogun, who came from a long line of wood carvers and wanted to preserve local traditions, has been buried following his death after a brief illness.

originalTitle: Nigeria police deny reports of mass church abductions in north
title: Nigeria police deny reports of mass church abductions in north
content: A state police commissioner said the information was "mere falsehood... peddled by conflict entrepreneurs".

originalTitle: Syria’s war-ravaged oil sector faces tough road to recovery, analysts say
title: Syria’s war-ravaged oil sector faces tough road to recovery, analysts say
content: Syrian government's control of energy reserves from SDF has raised hopes of return to pre-war production levels.

originalTitle: How a year of Trump has reshaped the US and the world
title: How a year of Trump has reshaped the US and the world
content: The first year of Trump 2.0 featured deportations, tariffs and an abducted president.

originalTitle: Tymoshenko vs Zelenskyy: Political clash over graft rocks wartime Ukraine
title: Tymoshenko vs Zelenskyy: Political clash over graft rocks wartime Ukraine
content: Opposition politician Tymoshenko is accused of trying to obstruct cabinet appointments as she clashes with Zelenskyy.

originalTitle: Trump says he will '100%' carry out Greenland tariffs threat, as EU vows to protect its interests
title: Trump says he will '100%' carry out Greenland tariffs threat, as EU vows to protect its interests
content: Kaja Kallas, the EU's foreign policy chief, said the bloc has "no interest to pick a fight, but we will hold our ground".

originalTitle: Confronted over Greenland, Europe is ditching its softly-softly approach to Trump
title: Confronted over Greenland, Europe is ditching its softly-softly approach to Trump
content: Transatlantic relations aren't broken, though they are damaged. And if Europeans want to try to cut through with Trump, they'll have to stick together, writes Europe Editor Katya Adler

originalTitle: Ros Atkins on...President Trump's year in numbers
title: Ros Atkins on...President Trump's year in numbers
content: Executive orders, pardons, trips and Truth Social posts - the BBC’s Analysis Editor breaks down Donald Trump’s first year back in office, in numbers.

originalTitle: Saved by 'special talent' - but did penalty award wrong Brighton?
title: Saved by 'special talent' - but did penalty award wrong Brighton?
content: Charalampos Kostoulas earned Brighton a point with a stunning overhead kick but  were the Seagulls right to be angry over an earlier penalty award?

originalTitle: The day I discovered the Everton contract Revie never signed
title: The day I discovered the Everton contract Revie never signed
content: This is the story of how an unsigned contract that lay hidden in a bungalow for more than 50 years could have changed the course of English football.

title: Bournemouth sign midfielder Toth for £10.4m
content: Bournemouth sign Hungary international Alex Toth for £10.4m from Ferencvaros, with the midfielder joining the Cherries on a five-and-half-year contract.
